lines.text: Some men are broken by the laws that they break, unable to resist the forces that are pulling them down. Other men live by the rules that society sets down. You're not one of them.
I won. "Reaction." You can't ever take that away from me.
Take him to the hole.
[last lines]
I became a baseball fan. You did it Henri.
When you try to win sometimes, you lose sight of th goal.
Did you kill Rufus McCain?
I was the weapon, but I ain't no killer.
How do you think the Yankees will do against the Redskins this year?
The Yankees are a baseball team. The Redskins are a football team. Personally, I think the Redskins would kick the shit out of them.
I will ask you what I want to ask you.
And I answer what I want to answer.
Fine.
Fine.
Unlike many men who lived long after, Henry Young did not die in vain. In the end he was not afraid. He lived and he died in triumphed. If only we could all do that.
Action - I won. Reaction - you can't ever take that away from me.
ln life for every action there is a definite and distinct reaction. Action
[cuts his hand with his razor]
... reaction
[we see the blood dripping from the hand]
Yes, Mr. Glenn.

l have a family that l will not be able to provide for! Now, knowing this information, can you tell me why you would possibly want to escape and jeopardize my family? l've done nothing to you but my job. And instead of letting you learn by breaking the rules, l feel l need to show you how to obey them. Tolerance. Tolerance for pain. My tolerance of you. But tolerance can be mistaken for kindness. And kindness can be mistaken for weakness. And we can't have weakness, can we, Henri?

[to Stamphill]
I don't know who you pissed off to get this piece of shit case, but that's the breaks!
[first lines]
They're coming! Run!
To restore to a state of physical, mental, and moral health through treatment and training.
I was wondering if I could talk to you, sir, about a continuance.
No.
You don't understand, sir, he just sits there. I can't even get him to speak.
Well maybe he's practicing for the gas chamber. Tell him to take deep breaths.

[murder conviction looming]
Mister Young, we have *got* to talk. Would you like a cigarette?
No thanks, that shit'll kill ya.
I got nothin'. I got nobody. I don't need a lawyer, I need a friend.
Hey, you wanna do something for me? Let's play cards...
Mr. Young, I am not here to satisfy any sexual fantasies that you might have.
[said by the female attorney]
You're not?
No, I'm your attorney.
[said by the female attorney]
Honey, you're gonna have to get it up first. It's like trying to stick an oyster into a slot machine.
I do not need *you* to tell me what is, or is not okay. In this court room, *I* am the one who decides what is, or is not okay. Okay?
Mr. Stamphill, you are skating on very thin ice.
Maybe your Honor, but I'd like to get to the other side.
I wanna stop being afraid.
